summary: The bill, titled the Providing Useful Relief for Enhanced Water Act (PURE Water Act), amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a tax credit for the purchase and installation of water filtration systems in homes. The credit is 20% of qualified primary residence filtration expenditures and 10% for non-primary residences, up to a maximum of $2,500. Qualified filters must remove at least 90% of lead, PFAS, and PFOAS. The effective date is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
